availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, North Carolina native. Son of William B. Glover and Martha Lewis Glover. Student in St. Louis, Missouri, in 1850. Signed a petition to Beriah Magoffin on behalf of Wesley [Unknown] in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in July 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Missouri, St. Louis County, District 82, p. 499A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 508B.
"Joseph L. Glover (1836-1883)," Find A Grave, Memorial #195992704, accessed February 14, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/195992704.
North Carolina Marriage Bonds - Abstracts 1760 - 1957, North Carolina State Archives, Raleigh, NC, RG 048, Granville County, p. 110.
